decks.notes: The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Glaring Fleshraker and Wastescape+Battlemage','','');">Wastescape Battlemage provide additional aggression. The deck also utilizes lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple to reduce the cost of Eldrazi spells. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and disruptive elements while maintaining a strong mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt your opponent's game plan through hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy, while also using efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to maintain board presence with creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Amped Raptor, while also utilizing damage output from Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The mana base includes lands like Wasteland and Karakas to further disrupt the opponent's strategy, making it difficult for them to establish their own board presence.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then bringing them back into play with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and stop the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to reanimate huge threats early in the game, overwhelming the opponent and quickly closing out the match before they have a chance to respond effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and reanimating them with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the game. The win condition is usually bringing back a high-impact creature like Archon of Cruelty or Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and utility spells like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to ensure consistency and flexibility in its strategy.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures to control the board and keep the opponent on the back foot. The deck also includes some powerful planeswalkers and utility creatures to generate card advantage and further disrupt the opponent's strategies. The mana base is constructed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency. Overall, this deck is designed to be proactive in disrupting the opponent's plans and securing victory through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and counter spells like Daze, while also using cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for key cards. The inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares helps to disrupt the opponent's graveyard and prevent them from executing their own game plan effectively. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo and aggression to outpace the opponent and secure a victory.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock them out of the game using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to control the board with aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf while also utilizing powerful removal spells like Sundering Eruption and Fury. The inclusion of fast mana accelerants like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide allows the deck to quickly deploy its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using early creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by a disruption package of countermagic and removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board with tempo-efficient spells like Daze and Wasteland while also maintaining card advantage with cantrips like Ponder and Mishra's Bauble. The strategy revolves around fast-paced aggression while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately closing out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then reanimating them with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also utilizes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and control the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to cheat out expensive creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats that can easily win the game if left unchecked.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The strategy centers around cheating expensive creatures into play early in the game to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the opponent's plays. The key strategy is to efficiently reanimate powerful threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping out powerful artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It leverages cards like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal to accelerate its mana production and cast threats like Karn, the Great Creator and The One Ring. Chalice of the Void provides disruption for opposing decks, while cards like Fury and Broadside Bombardiers provide additional aggression and removal. The deck aims to control the game early with powerful threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately securing victory through efficiency and overwhelming force.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, while using counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The key strategy is to cheat powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty or Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play as early as possible to overwhelm the opponent. Murktide Regent provides a big threat in the air, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces. Wasteland disrupts the opponent's mana base, while Thoughtseize helps strip away any potential threats.

This deck revolves around using artifacts to generate mana and create a powerful combo with Mystic Forge. By utilizing cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to manipulate the board state in its favor and assemble key pieces for the combo. The inclusion of cards like Pithing Needle and Planar Nexus helps disrupt opponent's strategies while maintaining the focus on the main win condition. With efficient mana generation and powerful artifacts, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through its intricate combo interactions.

This deck revolves around assembling powerful artifact combos using cards like Mystic Forge, Ugin, Eye of the Storms, and Karn, the Great Creator. By utilizing cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal for fast mana generation, along with key pieces like Voltaic Key and Manifold Key to manipulate artifacts, this deck is able to create overwhelming board states and generate immense value. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Tormod's Crypt and Portable Hole helps to control the opponent's board while setting up the combo pieces for victory.

The key concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Magus of the Moon. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and control the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's three-color strategy while also allowing for flexibility in casting spells of various colors. The deck focuses on controlling the game and winning through incremental advantage and resource management.

The deck focuses on using various spells and artifacts to quickly generate mana and draw cards, while also manipulating the opponent's hand to disrupt their game plan. By combining these elements, the deck is able to build up a high storm count and ultimately cast Tendrils of Agony to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Burning Wish and Wishclaw Talisman allows for additional flexibility in finding key combo pieces or answers to specific threats. Overall, the deck aims to chain together spells to create a powerful storm win condition.
